|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Z-Com XI-325 |rad1modif = PCMCIA (16-bit) |rad1chip1 = Intersil;ISL3873B; |rad1chip2 = Intersil;ISL3685; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = RP-MMCX, RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ''The firmware/driver for this product is no longer available for download. :We regret any inconvenience this may cause you.'' Lame.
{{See also|Linksys WML11B}}
"GN00D" is silkscreened under the board under the ''[[SerComm]]''-esque label. :"MADE IN TAIWAN" is silkscreeened to the left of that. :''[[SerComm]]'' is the presumed OEM of this device.
The device is using the [http://pdf1.alldatasheet.com/datasheet-pdf/view/77314/INTEL/PXA255.html Intel PXA255 (''PXA255A0C200'')].
A '''Linksys''' MAC (rather than the card's default '''Z-Com''' MAC) would appear :to be used for the wireless interface. By default, this device will broadcast an SSID of '''linksys_wma11b''' in Ad-Hoc mode.
==Links of Interest== *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/userguide/wma11b_ug.pdf User's Guide] **[http://download.modem-help.co.uk/mfcs-L/LinkSys/WMA11B/ WMA11B files on m-h] *[http://datasheet.seekic.com/PdfFile/EM7/EM78P156EL_EMC_ELAN_Microelectronics_Cor.pdf MCU ''EM78P156EL'' datasheet]
